name: Flat-backed Turtle
description: Named for its characteristically flat shell, which is bright yellow or green in juveniles. Uniquely among turtles, it has 6 vertebral scutes (others have 5).
spread_note: Southern Asia, from eastern Malaysia and Thailand to Sumatra and Java
food_note: Invertebrates, parts of aquatic plants, fallen fruits, to a lesser extent aquatic invertebrates
reproduction: Details are scarce, but it typically lays 2–3 relatively large eggs, buried on the shore.
attractions: A very shy turtle, it prefers hiding in plant tangles. It is most active in the morning and late afternoon, or after rain. It rarely appears in human care.
breeding: We have kept this interesting turtle since 2004.
